project.name: 3D Portfolio Website
project.description: A cinematic personal portfolio built with Three.js, GSAP, and vanilla JavaScript. The goal is to learn by collaborating with GitHub Copilot while keeping full creative control over the logic and structure.

developer_intent.primary_goal: Use Copilot for scaffolding, setup, and partial code completions while understanding and writing all core logic manually.
learning_focus: Shader materials and lighting in WebGL
Optimized asset loading and modular organization
copilot_rules: Prefer vanilla JavaScript — do not suggest React or React Three Fiber.
Write modular and readable code, using ES module imports/exports.
Include short inline comments explaining reasoning and structure.
Do not generate long or complete files unless explicitly asked.
Avoid placeholder content unrelated to 3D or animation.

html_css.style_guide: flat, cinematic aesthetic; use CSS for layout and GSAP for motion

collaboration_guidelines.copilot_role: Assist with setup, propose modular patterns, and explain unfamiliar code.
collaboration_guidelines.developer_role: Write logic, refine design, and understand every part of the implementation.
collaboration_guidelines.communication_style: Concise and educational — prefer short suggestions over long outputs.
